trans-unit.source: Survival Analysis with Azure Machine Learning | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Survival Analysis with Azure Machine Learning | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Survival Analysis event occurrence probability
trans-unit.target: Survival Analysis event occurrence probability

trans-unit.source: Survival Analysis
trans-unit.target: Survival Analysis

trans-unit.source: Under many scenarios, the main outcome under assessment is the time to an event of interest.
trans-unit.target: Under many scenarios, the main outcome under assessment is the time to an event of interest.

trans-unit.source: In other words, the question “when this event will occur?”
trans-unit.target: In other words, the question “when this event will occur?”

trans-unit.source: is asked.
trans-unit.target: is asked.

trans-unit.source: As examples, consider situations where the data describes the elapsed time (days, years, mileage, etc.) until the event of interest (disease relapse, PhD degree received, brake pad failure) occurs.
trans-unit.target: As examples, consider situations where the data describes the elapsed time (days, years, mileage, etc.) until the event of interest (disease relapse, PhD degree received, brake pad failure) occurs.

trans-unit.source: Each instance in the data represents a specific object (a patient, a student, a car, etc.).
trans-unit.target: Each instance in the data represents a specific object (a patient, a student, a car, etc.).

trans-unit.source: This [web service]( https://datamarket.azure.com/dataset/aml_labs/survivalanalysis) answers the question “what is the probability that the event of interest will occur by time n for object x?”
trans-unit.target: This [web service]( https://datamarket.azure.com/dataset/aml_labs/survivalanalysis) answers the question “what is the probability that the event of interest will occur by time n for object x?”

trans-unit.source: By providing a survival analysis model, this web service enables users to supply data to train the model and test it.
trans-unit.target: By providing a survival analysis model, this web service enables users to supply data to train the model and test it.

trans-unit.source: The main theme of the experiment is to model the length of the elapsed time until the event of interest occurs.
trans-unit.target: The main theme of the experiment is to model the length of the elapsed time until the event of interest occurs.

trans-unit.source: This web service could be consumed by users – potentially through a mobile app, through a website, or even on a local computer, for example.
trans-unit.target: This web service could be consumed by users – potentially through a mobile app, through a website, or even on a local computer, for example.

trans-unit.source: But the purpose of the web service is also to serve as an example of how Azure Machine Learning can be used to create web services on top of R code.
trans-unit.target: But the purpose of the web service is also to serve as an example of how Azure Machine Learning can be used to create web services on top of R code.

trans-unit.source: With just a few lines of R code and clicks of a button within Azure Machine Learning Studio, an experiment can be created with R code and published as a web service.
trans-unit.target: With just a few lines of R code and clicks of a button within Azure Machine Learning Studio, an experiment can be created with R code and published as a web service.

trans-unit.source: The web service can then be published to the Azure Marketplace and consumed by users and devices across the world with no infrastructure setup by the author of the web service.
trans-unit.target: The web service can then be published to the Azure Marketplace and consumed by users and devices across the world with no infrastructure setup by the author of the web service.

trans-unit.source: Consumption of web service
trans-unit.target: Consumption of web service

trans-unit.source: The input data schema of the web service is shown in the following table.
trans-unit.target: The input data schema of the web service is shown in the following table.

trans-unit.source: Six pieces of information are needed as the input: training data, testing data, time of interest, the index of "time" dimension, the index of "event" dimension, and the variable types (continuous or factor).
trans-unit.target: Six pieces of information are needed as the input: training data, testing data, time of interest, the index of "time" dimension, the index of "event" dimension, and the variable types (continuous or factor).

trans-unit.source: The training data is represented with a string, where the rows are separated by comma, and the columns are separated by semicolon.
trans-unit.target: The training data is represented with a string, where the rows are separated by comma, and the columns are separated by semicolon.

trans-unit.source: The number of features of the data is flexible.
trans-unit.target: The number of features of the data is flexible.

trans-unit.source: All the elements in the input string must be numeric.
trans-unit.target: All the elements in the input string must be numeric.

trans-unit.source: In the training data, the “time” dimension indicates the number of time units (days, years, mileage, etc.) elapsed since the starting point of the study (a patient receiving drug treatment programs, a student starting PhD study, a car starting to be driven, etc.) until the event of interest (the patient returning to drug usage, the student obtaining the PhD degree, the car having brake pad failure, etc.) occurs.
trans-unit.target: In the training data, the “time” dimension indicates the number of time units (days, years, mileage, etc.) elapsed since the starting point of the study (a patient receiving drug treatment programs, a student starting PhD study, a car starting to be driven, etc.) until the event of interest (the patient returning to drug usage, the student obtaining the PhD degree, the car having brake pad failure, etc.) occurs.

trans-unit.source: The “event” dimension indicates whether the event of interest occurs at the end of the study.
trans-unit.target: The “event” dimension indicates whether the event of interest occurs at the end of the study.

trans-unit.source: A value of “event=1” means that the event of interest occurs at the time indicated by the “time” dimension; “event=0” means that the event of interest has not occurred by the time indicated by the “time” dimension.
trans-unit.target: A value of “event=1” means that the event of interest occurs at the time indicated by the “time” dimension; “event=0” means that the event of interest has not occurred by the time indicated by the “time” dimension.

trans-unit.source: trainingdata - A character string.
trans-unit.target: trainingdata - A character string.

trans-unit.source: Rows are separated by comma, and columns are separated by semicolon.
trans-unit.target: Rows are separated by comma, and columns are separated by semicolon.

trans-unit.source: Each row includes “time” dimension, “event” dimension, and predictor variables.
trans-unit.target: Each row includes “time” dimension, “event” dimension, and predictor variables.

trans-unit.source: testingdata - One row of data that contains predictor variables for a particular object.
trans-unit.target: testingdata - One row of data that contains predictor variables for a particular object.

trans-unit.source: time_of_interest - The elapsed time of interest n.
trans-unit.target: time_of_interest - The elapsed time of interest n.

trans-unit.source: index_time - The column index of the “time” dimension (starting from 1).
trans-unit.target: index_time - The column index of the “time” dimension (starting from 1).

trans-unit.source: index_event - The column index of the “event” dimension (starting from 1).
trans-unit.target: index_event - The column index of the “event” dimension (starting from 1).

trans-unit.source: variable_types - A character string with semicolons as separators in it.
trans-unit.target: variable_types - A character string with semicolons as separators in it.

trans-unit.source: 0 represents continuous variables and 1 represents factor variables.
trans-unit.target: 0 represents continuous variables and 1 represents factor variables.

trans-unit.source: The output is the probability of an event occurring by a specific time.
trans-unit.target: The output is the probability of an event occurring by a specific time.

trans-unit.source: This service, as hosted on the Azure Marketplace, is an OData service; these may be called through POST or GET methods.
trans-unit.target: This service, as hosted on the Azure Marketplace, is an OData service; these may be called through POST or GET methods.

trans-unit.source: There are multiple ways of consuming the service in an automated fashion (an example app is [here](http://microsoftazuremachinelearning.azurewebsites.net/SurvivalAnalysis.aspx)).
trans-unit.target: There are multiple ways of consuming the service in an automated fashion (an example app is [here](http://microsoftazuremachinelearning.azurewebsites.net/SurvivalAnalysis.aspx)).

trans-unit.source: Starting C# code for web service consumption:
trans-unit.target: Starting C# code for web service consumption:

trans-unit.source: public class Input
trans-unit.target: public class Input

trans-unit.source: public string trainingdata;
trans-unit.target: public string trainingdata;

trans-unit.source: public string testingdata;
trans-unit.target: public string testingdata;

trans-unit.source: public string timeofinterest;
trans-unit.target: public string timeofinterest;

trans-unit.source: public string indextime;
trans-unit.target: public string indextime;

trans-unit.source: public string indexevent;
trans-unit.target: public string indexevent;

trans-unit.source: public string variabletypes;
trans-unit.target: public string variabletypes;

trans-unit.source: The interpretation of this test is as follows.
trans-unit.target: The interpretation of this test is as follows.

trans-unit.source: Assuming the goal of the data is to model the elapsed time until the return to drug usage for the patients who received one of the two treatment programs.
trans-unit.target: Assuming the goal of the data is to model the elapsed time until the return to drug usage for the patients who received one of the two treatment programs.

trans-unit.source: The output of the web service reads: for patients being 35 years old, having previous drug treatment 2 times, taking the long residential treatment program, and with both heroin and cocaine usage, the probability of returning to the drug usage is 95.64% by day 500.
trans-unit.target: The output of the web service reads: for patients being 35 years old, having previous drug treatment 2 times, taking the long residential treatment program, and with both heroin and cocaine usage, the probability of returning to the drug usage is 95.64% by day 500.

trans-unit.source: Creation of web service
trans-unit.target: Creation of web service

trans-unit.source: This web service was created using Azure Machine Learning.
trans-unit.target: This web service was created using Azure Machine Learning.

trans-unit.source: For a free trial, as well as introductory videos on creating experiments and [publishing web services](machine-learning-publish-a-machine-learning-web-service.md), please see [azure.com/ml](http://azure.com/ml).
trans-unit.target: For a free trial, as well as introductory videos on creating experiments and [publishing web services](machine-learning-publish-a-machine-learning-web-service.md), please see [azure.com/ml](http://azure.com/ml).

trans-unit.source: Below is a screenshot of the experiment that created the web service and example code for each of the modules within the experiment.
trans-unit.target: Below is a screenshot of the experiment that created the web service and example code for each of the modules within the experiment.

trans-unit.source: From within Azure Machine Learning, a new blank experiment was created and two [Execute R Script][execute-r-script] modules were pulled onto the workspace.
trans-unit.target: From within Azure Machine Learning, a new blank experiment was created and two [Execute R Script][execute-r-script] modules were pulled onto the workspace.

trans-unit.source: The data schema was created with a simple [Execute R Script][execute-r-script], which defines the input data schema for the web service.
trans-unit.target: The data schema was created with a simple [Execute R Script][execute-r-script], which defines the input data schema for the web service.

trans-unit.source: This module is then linked to the second [Execute R Script][execute-r-script] module, which does major work.
trans-unit.target: This module is then linked to the second [Execute R Script][execute-r-script] module, which does major work.

trans-unit.source: This module does data preprocessing, model building, and predictions.
trans-unit.target: This module does data preprocessing, model building, and predictions.

trans-unit.source: In the data preprocessing step, the input data represented by a long string is transformed and converted into a data frame.
trans-unit.target: In the data preprocessing step, the input data represented by a long string is transformed and converted into a data frame.

trans-unit.source: In the model building step, an external R package “survival_2.37-7.zip” is first installed for conducting survival analysis.
trans-unit.target: In the model building step, an external R package “survival_2.37-7.zip” is first installed for conducting survival analysis.

trans-unit.source: Then the “coxph” function is executed after a series data processing tasks.
trans-unit.target: Then the “coxph” function is executed after a series data processing tasks.

trans-unit.source: The details of the “coxph” function for survival analysis can be read from the R documentation.
trans-unit.target: The details of the “coxph” function for survival analysis can be read from the R documentation.

trans-unit.source: In the prediction step, a testing instance is supplied into the trained model with the “surfit” function, and the survival curve for this testing instance is produced as “curve” variable.
trans-unit.target: In the prediction step, a testing instance is supplied into the trained model with the “surfit” function, and the survival curve for this testing instance is produced as “curve” variable.

trans-unit.source: Finally, the probability of the time of interest is obtained.
trans-unit.target: Finally, the probability of the time of interest is obtained.

trans-unit.source: Limitations
trans-unit.target: Limitations

trans-unit.source: This web service can take only numerical values as feature variables (columns).
trans-unit.target: This web service can take only numerical values as feature variables (columns).

trans-unit.source: The “event” column can take only value 0 or 1.
trans-unit.target: The “event” column can take only value 0 or 1.

trans-unit.source: The “time” column needs to be a positive integer.
trans-unit.target: The “time” column needs to be a positive integer.
